page.title: 08REPORTS ON FARMING PARENTS
page.content: The majority of our farms produce sheep,beef cattle,a dairy herd,pigs and/or cereal crops. "My father lectures at Exeter Collage. My mother stays at home and farms.They get up between 6 and 7.Mum sees to the ponies while dad sees to and counts the sheep.Then we have breakfast.When we have gone to school mum goes round the house doing her chores.During lambing mum has to check the sheep about every two hours.We have 50 breeding ewes." "My father is a herb salesman.He runs his own herb farm which has 120 different varieties.He delivers herbs to restaurants and shops, mainly in Exeter.He is also the chef at our hotel."
